title: @Riot, we haven't had a Demacian or Noxus champion in over 4 years.
body: Will we get another one soon? It just seems like they aren't canon anymore.

replies.body: We've been talking about the lack of Demacian/Noxian champions ourselves a bit too recently. TLDR is we would like to make some more at some point. We've seen stronger opportunities in other factions/archetypes for a while though. That's in part because quite a few of the bigger Champion Updates (Sion, Poppy, Taric) are associated with those factions (and so too are some of the stronger candidates for future large updates, Galio and Swain for example), so that creative space is still getting worked in. I'm sure we'll see new champions from both Demacia and Noxus sometime though.

I think Riot should consider making more champions that are just ''cool'' or ''badass'' Like yeah i think yasuo is riots biggest mistake because he has an extremely toxic and unfair kit that both teams need to deal with, But he is really pretty sweet, The voice, looks, skills, sword everything.

If you understand what i mean ? haha

Shen is alot more than just cool. He takes neither the side of good nor evil, simply justice. He's a cold-hearted deliverant of justice.

His encounter with Jhin made him this way. Jhin's art twisted Shen from the lighthearted person he once was into the emotionless warrior he is now. Plus afterwards his longtime friend and fellow disciple Zed, who was also twisted by Jhin's art and Shen's father's decision to spare him, killed Shen's father and then pursued forbidden techniques.

So really he's not just a cool guy at all. He's pychologically scarred in many ways and he's fed up with the world after seeing so much injustice. So now he simply wants to rid the world of injustice via killing everyone who he perceives to be "evil".

Akali's and Kennen's views on the matter are unknown but they are known to assist him.

If every champion that comes out is a special snowflake, at least in terms of god/celestial/demon/special unaffiliated character, then it detracts from the interest that should inspire.

"Oh look, another immortal god-thing on the rift. Yawn."

That's just my opinion, though.

May I ask what ever happened to the Tahm, Bard, and Rek'Sai lores that were supposed to be released? I remember a Rioter awhile back saying they were going to be released "soon", but I don't remember ever seeing them.
Meddler isn't the right person to ask that. Remember, he's a part of the gameplay team; so he would probably not know the details of what happened to those champs' long lore.
Yeah, I thought so. There was just a possibility that he might have been able to ask another Rioter about, but it's fine.

Kindred is pretty much Runeterra's version of the Grim Reaper, so they don't actually need a faction.

Bard is a babysitter to Runeterra, arrives in time to stop people from fucking anything up. He's there to preserve a certain balance upon the world, to keep things in motion. For example; if Bard saves a person it's not because he wants to, he saved that person because he either has an important destiny to fulfill in the future or is going to have a child that will benefit the world.

Tahm Kench is a representation of mankind's flaws. He doesn't need a faction because he has no desire to, all he wants is to feast upon anything that peaks his specific tastes depending on a person's flaws. His appearance, personality, and even his name changes with every victim from any culture. The reason he's sided in Bilgewater is because the Gambler, who is named Tahm Kench, is from Bilgewater, and that's where this demon went.
Swain again? Is Swain the new Ryze? Someone either useless or overpowered in the states you put him in.

Swain was always looking at a full rework; he wasn't part of the main 6, and I remember someone way back when (probably Meddler) saying that he might not even be in the mage update since he needed more work than what they could do in a roster update.
Yep. The mid-season changes to Swain were very much a case of 'we know this guy needs big changes, but those are a long way off so here are some things we think are worth exploring in the meantime'.
